author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Free Creative Process workshops set
text:
Free Creative Process workshops set Oct 16, 2015 Teresa Piccari 
Camden — Creative Process: Exploring Your Artistry, a free interactive program, will be offered by Teresa Piccari at Camden Public Library and is open to writers and artists of all genres. This two-hour workshop will be offered twice: Sunday, Oct. 25, from 2 to 4 p.m.; and Tuesday, Oct. 27, from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m.; call the library at 236-3440 to sign up. 
“Together we will explore the creative process that you currently apply to your work as an artist or writer and learn how you can expand it to be more focused and productive,” said Piccari. “We will discuss the importance of having a strong vision of your creative self and setting goals that will motivate and inspire you.” 
Piccari will share tools and techniques that will support the understanding of one’s unique creativity. Combining these with activities that have already proven successful, she will guide participants in putting together a creative practice that can serve as the foundation of their artistry. Attendees should come with paper and pen, prepared to participate in dynamic discussion and creative prompts and exercises. 
Piccari, proprietor of The Village Scribe, is a writer, teacher and creativity coach. A professional writer for 32 years, Piccari has been teaching writing for 18 years. Her workshop palette includes Creative Writing, Heroic Journey and Memoir & Personal Essay. She is a longtime columnist who enjoys writing about art, healing and transformation as part of the creative process. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
